docs.title: Intelligent Instruments Lab
docs.text: The Intelligent Instruments Lab is an interdisciplinary research lab that investigates the role of artificial intelligence in new musical instruments, based at the Iceland University of the Arts in Reykjavik. Music is our research base, but the reach and impact is wider and we explore how musical interfaces can be applied as scientific instruments, for example through sonification.

docs.title: iil-examples
docs.text: examples of creative use of our projects.

docs.title: iipyper
docs.text: Python package for fast creation of Open Sound Control (OSC) and MIDI-based event loops.

docs.title: tolvera
docs.text: library for exploring musical performance with artificial life (ALife) and self-organising systems.
